CatDescriptText: Miss Margaret Worthy, hospital technician, West Mifflin and Mr. Tom Broadus, auto mechanic, Herron Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 9, 1961, pg. 5 with question: "Do you think that in the final analysis, the uncommitted darker nations will join the democratic (pro-Western) or Communistic bloc?  Why?"  Miss Margaret Worthy's answer reads: "I think it depends on who gives the most help to the uncommitted nations at the time this help is most needed."  Mr. Tom Broadus' answer reads: "I think the democratic bloc because the Communists have created so much trouble throughout the world."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Margaret Worthy wearing light colored button down shirt with short flared sleeves, standing in front of two signs, one inscribed "Same Day Service"; Portrait of Tom Broadus wearing plaid button down collared shirt, standing in front of store window with signs including "Bowling Balls"
